GET /accounts/{account_id}/pages/project.description: Fetch a list of project deployments.

schema.description: What type of deployments to fetch.
Which page of deployments to fetch.
How many deployments to return per page.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful.

count.description: Total number of results for the requested service.

page.description: Current page within paginated list of results.

per_page.description: Number of results per page of results.

total_count.description: Total results available without any search parameters.

aliases.description: A list of alias URLs pointing to this deployment.

build_config.description: Configs for the project build process.

build_caching.description: Enable build caching for the project.

destination_dir.description: Assets output directory of the build.

deployment_trigger.description: Info about what caused the deployment.

commit_dirty.description: Whether the deployment trigger commit was dirty.

commit_hash.description: Hash of the deployment trigger commit.

commit_message.description: Message of the deployment trigger commit.

env_vars.description: Environment variables used for builds and Pages Functions.

is_skipped.description: If the deployment has been skipped.

modified_on.description: When the deployment was last modified.

short_id.description: Short Id (8 character) of the deployment.

source.description: Configs for the project source control.

deployments_enabled.description:
Whether to enable automatic deployments when pushing to the source repository.
When disabled, no deployments (production or preview) will be triggered automatically.
deployments_enabled.x-stainless-deprecation-message: Use `production_deployments_enabled` and `preview_deployment_setting` for more granular control.

owner_id.description: The owner ID of the repository.

path_excludes.description: A list of paths that should be excluded from triggering a preview deployment. Wildcard syntax (`*`) is supported.

path_includes.description: A list of paths that should be watched to trigger a preview deployment. Wildcard syntax (`*`) is supported.

preview_branch_excludes.description: A list of branches that should not trigger a preview deployment. Wildcard syntax (`*`) is supported. Must be used with `preview_deployment_setting` set to `custom`.

preview_branch_includes.description: A list of branches that should trigger a preview deployment. Wildcard syntax (`*`) is supported. Must be used with `preview_deployment_setting` set to `custom`.

preview_deployment_setting.description: Controls whether commits to preview branches trigger a preview deployment.

production_branch.description: The production branch of the repository.

production_deployments_enabled.description: Whether to trigger a production deployment on commits to the production branch.

url.description: The live URL to view this deployment.

POST /accounts/{account_id}/pages/projec.description: Start a new deployment from production. The repository and account must have already been authorized on the Cloudflare Pages dashboard.

_headers.description: Headers configuration file for the deployment.

_redirects.description: Redirects configuration file for the deployment.

_routes.json.description: Routes configuration file defining routing rules.

_worker.bundle.description:
Worker bundle file in multipart/form-data format. Mutually exclusive with `_worker.js`.
Cannot specify both `_worker.js` and `_worker.bundle` in the same request.
Maximum size: 25 MiB.

_worker.js.description:
Worker JavaScript file. Mutually exclusive with `_worker.bundle`.
Cannot specify both `_worker.js` and `_worker.bundle` in the same request.

branch.description: The branch to build the new deployment from. The `HEAD` of the branch will be used. If omitted, the production branch will be used by default.

commit_dirty.description: Boolean string indicating if the working directory has uncommitted changes.

commit_hash.description: Git commit SHA associated with this deployment.

commit_message.description: Git commit message associated with this deployment.

manifest.description:
JSON string containing a manifest of files to deploy. Maps file paths to their content hashes.
Required for direct upload deployments. Maximum 20,000 entries.
